user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_unquoted_param:
```c
static enum _MHD_GetUnqResult
get_unquoted_param (const struct MHD_RqDAuthParam *param,
                    char tmp1[_MHD_STATIC_UNQ_BUFFER_SIZE],
                    char **ptmp2,
                    size_t *ptmp2_size,
                    struct _MHD_str_w_len *unquoted)
{
  char *str;
  size_t len;
  mhd_assert (NULL != param->value.str);
  mhd_assert (0 != param->value.len);

  if (! param->quoted)
  {
    unquoted->str = param->value.str;
    unquoted->len = param->value.len;
    return _MHD_UNQ_OK;
  }
  /* The value is present and is quoted, needs to be copied and unquoted */
  str = get_buffer_for_size (tmp1, ptmp2, ptmp2_size, param->value.len);
  if (NULL == str)
    return (param->value.len > _MHD_AUTH_DIGEST_MAX_PARAM_SIZE) ?
           _MHD_UNQ_TOO_LARGE : _MHD_UNQ_OUT_OF_MEM;

  len = MHD_str_unquote (param->value.str, param->value.len, str);
  unquoted->str = str;
  unquoted->len = len;
  mhd_assert (0 != unquoted->len);
  mhd_assert (unquoted->len < param->value.len);
  return _MHD_UNQ_OK;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No code fragment in the provided function uses the Standard Library function memcmp, nor performs any direct memory comparisons of null-terminated strings. The function only: assigns pointers and lengths, checks flags and sizes, calls helper functions (get_buffer_for_size, MHD_str_unquote) and uses assertions. There are no calls to memcmp, strcmp, strncmp, or similar string-comparison functions in this snippet. Therefore there are no fragments here that need investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14. (Note: implementations of the called helper functions are not shown; if those contain memcmp usage that compares null-terminated strings, they must be inspected separately, but that is outside the scope of this code fragment.)
